leitej.util.machine

Class XSecurityManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.SecurityManager
      • leitej.util.machine.XSecurityManager

  • public class XSecurityManager
extends java.lang.SecurityManager
    The class XSecurityManager and its subclasses are a form of SecurityManager.
    Useful to programmatically change JVM security measures.

    Only can be used one instance at a time. The constructor automatically set this security manager in System.
    Author:
    Julio Leite
    See Also:
    SecurityManager

      The constructor automatically set this security manager in System.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XSecurityManager

        public XSecurityManager()
                 throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                        IllegalStateLtRtException
        Constructs a new XSecurityManager.
        The constructor automatically set this security manager in System.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager already exists and its checkPermission method doesn't allow creation of a new security manager or if the security manager has already been set and doesn't allow it to be replaced
        IllegalStateLtRtException - if there are already an instance active

    • Method Detail

      • end

        public void end()
         throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Ends the appliance of this class measures, returning to the anterior ones.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the security manager checkPermission method doesn't allow it to be replaced
